body: @justinholmes anything I can do to help with this PR?  Definitely would love to get this merged.
LGTM
I wonder what is the use case to disable it?
@kaxil, fixed
@Fokko Sorry for delay, pushed the requested change.
@BrennerPablo the company names need to be in alphabetic order. Please fix!

> @BrennerPablo the company names need to be in alphabetic order. Please fix!

Thanks!

@BrennerPablo Awesome.. now one nit.. please prepend `[AIRFLOW-XXX]` to your commit message. We generate release notes from the first lines of commit messages, so this reads better. You don't need to create a JIRA for this trivial change -- you can use the placeholder value (XXX). 

Bonus points if you can squash your commits into 1.
This can be used as your QA environment with no dags on schedule
We were planning on building something similar...to just check if our dags executes end to end with no errors in it. If it is successful with manual triggers, then we will push it to for schedule

> This can be used as your QA environment with no dags on schedule
That's the planned use case for it, as well as if, for whatever reason, production jobs need to be stopped - the scheduler can be restarted with the config updated and the queue will drain without anything new entering, unless manually triggered.
Welcome aboard!!! Yours is the 200th official company to list itself on the company list!!!

@marklavrynenko-original This appears to be fixed in Master -- I can't reproduce this on Master and updated the Jira accordingly. If you have other steps to reproduce, feel free to reopen this or ping me.

I'm closing this for now.
@etrabelsi Apologies for bothering, but if you have a moment, would you mind adding me as a collaborator on your forked repo? Thank you!
Hi @kaxil , a gentle ping. This PR may be help make the authentication-related docs clearer, especially given we have two UIs available concurrently at this moment.

Thank you @kaxil for providing your inputs.

I have addressed accordingly. Kindly take another look. Thanks.
Can you also create a Jira issue? Any change that spans more than 1 line should have a jira.
We should definitely include this in 1.10.1

Thanks @ashb for fixing this.

@kaxil Good point. I've just cherry-picked it onto 1.10.1
@kaxil I've refactored the code a bit, let me know what you think. This changes the behaviour though, the main question is, do we want to create a file if there is nothing to write?
I agree with this logic. Can we add tests to check that the file is not created when there are no rows.

```

Running flake8 on the diff in the range 1411245..b2a71de (2 commit(s)):
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
airflow/migrations/versions/bf00311e1990_add_index_to_taskinstance.py:9:2: W291 trailing whitespace
#
 ^
airflow/migrations/versions/bf00311e1990_add_index_to_taskinstance.py:11:2: W291 trailing whitespace
#
 ^
airflow/migrations/versions/bf00311e1990_add_index_to_taskinstance.py:33:1: E402 module level import not at top of file
from alembic import op
```
User password doesn't store in airflow but in a SSO or other external key management. The fix seems to be a little hacky and only tailer for DB authentication which is least useful for production.

if error not in the css, should we add it to the bootstrap-theme.css instead of modifying every line for a new type of error? It will help to reduce numbers of line we need to fix. Besides flashing an exception with warning doesn't seem that right.

Hi @feng-tao, actually I though of these two concerns you’re pointing out:

1.  to my understanding, bootstrap-theme.css is maintained using npm. We should not make change to it in our codebase. I hesitated if I should fix from bootstrap-theme.css, but eventually gave up due to this reason.

2. Putting “warning” rather than “danger”: I also hesitated back and forth on this. Some Exceptions here are not causing system-wide trouble, like failed to import Variable. Putting “danger” category seems too much (available options are only “success”, “info”, “warning”, “danger”).

Hi @kaxil , sorry I thought no ticket is required as long as it's only documentation change.

I have raised a JIRA ticket (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-3070) and updated the PR subject, PR message body, and commit msg subject accordingly.

Thanks.

I think this is one part of the questions: if the user password is not stored in airflow but in an external key management, should we allow user to change password from Airflow or can we implement that? Personally I don't think it's a good idea. That's why I suggested to give `can_userinfo` to all users (at least they don't get a weird 'Access is Denied' message when they try to check their own profile) but only allowing changing profile/password when it's DB authentication.

What I can do is to check how **superset** (https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset) is handling this, which is also based on Flask-AppBuilder if I'm not mistaken. It may provide some good ideas.

@feng-tao Unfortunately, in [**superset** ](https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset)(I'm using 0.26.3 for this testing) actually we have the same issue: Non-Admin users are redirected back to welcome page when they try to access their own profile page.

Seems no elegant/feasible solution for now.

I'll close this PR a while later (in case any other folks can give some good ideas). But I would suggest to leave the JIRA ticket (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-3048) open.

Thanks for the reviewing!
A friendly reminder for reviews :D

Thanks for the info. To give more context, lyft used both airflow and superset in production, both of which relies on google LDAP for authentication. Hence the password management is both done outside of these two tools.
@Fokko thanks for the feedback. I've updated the parameter name and added tweaks to the documentation.
@kaxil PTAL :)
@Nadbkl can you add @ndmar?
@Fokko  is this still relevant?
@ron819 I think it is a good idea to set the `schedule_interval`, but the link to the docs is old (refers to Airbnb).

@ndmar The reason is takes soo long to get this merged is the poor quality of the PR. Don't get me wrong, but I invested some time in helping, but still a lot isn't addressed, for example:

- Incomplete docstring.
- Extremely minimal tests.
- Not following the GIT guidelines regarding the formatting of the commits. 
- Not updating the docs.

I'm happy to do another review, but first please get it to a decent level of quality.

@XD-DENG Hey, No worries :-) . The idea behind there is no point in creating a Jira where we are just fixing typos or a single line document change. Everything other than that should have a Jira :) 

Really appreciate all of your contributions. Keep contributing 🎉  and thanks for this PR as well.

Thanks @kaxil . Appreciate the time you guys contributed as well. Especially now, a Sunday :) 

A nice afternoon ahead.

Hi @dud225 
I wanted to see if you were still interested in taking a crack at this. If I don't hear back in a few days, I'll close this. You are welcome to reopen it however.

Hi @dennisobrien 
How would you like to proceed with this PR? Would you like to take another crack? If so, I'd be happy to take a look at it. If I don't hear back in a few days, I'll close this out.

@robin-miller-ow A few questions:
1. Would you be interested in making this work on all views, instead of just on the Graph View? 
2. Also, instead of making the update in the configuration file, it would make more sense for each user to pick a refresh interval that made sense to him/her. Hence, it would be better to surface a UI control that allowed folks to pick a refresh interval that could persisted via a cookie from one session to another.

Let me know if you'd like to take this forward. I'd be happy to stick with this to see it merged.

@Fokko I rebased again and made following changes:

* Instead of using a `reschedule` boolean flag I switched to `mode` property with possible values `poke` (default) and `reschedule` to allow other modes in future (e.g. `in_scheduler` as mentioned by Maxime).
* Changed the Gantt view based on feedback from Pedro, see screenshots in the Jira issue.
* Changed the CSS class in Gantt for the `NONE` state to display as white instead of black, streamlined to graph and tree view.
* Added more tests and updated documentation

From my PoV it's ready to be merged.
I will try to spend some time on the pr tomorrow.
Hi @ashb , may you consider adding this fix into 1.10.1? Thanks

Hi @r39132 

I don't currently have time to put towards this unfortunately. I'm happy if you or anybody else wanted to pick up what I've done here and add to it before it's merged in.

If you are working further along these lines, one thing that might be of note: we've been using this as it is here in our deployment and have concluded that it would be worth disabling the loading spinner that occurs when the graph view is refreshed automatically, as it tends to get in the way.

Regarding your questions:

1. I see no reason why this could not be done, but I don't believe any of the other views have a corresponding refresh capability built in at the moment, so this would need to be created as part of this.
1. Again, I see no reason not to do this. As mentioned above, I'm not likely to get time to work on this any time soon, but I'd be inclined to view that as an enhancement to this functionality that could be added later - turning the configuration value into a default at that point.
We should be able to set up a separate branch beside the docker-compose, which installs minikube and spins the Airflow docker, right?
This looks quite similar to the: https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/master/airflow/operators/generic_transfer.py
Yes, thanks you @XD-DENG

LGTM, one minor think. Recently we've moved to a Docker-compose based CI pipeline. Instead of mocking the requests, there is also a real mongo instance running. What are your opinions on mocking, or talking to a real mongo instance?

@Fokko Thanks!

Regarding mocking vs real instance, I'm not sure I'm in the best position to answer that since I basically just built this PR upon the pre-existing setup, so I cannot say why `mongomock` was originally chosen.

But it looks like a pretty good library for this kind of thing, and since Travis is already taking a very long time to run, I assume mocking speeds thing up a bit in this case. I don't know how much that matters, but at least from my perspective, it feels like mocking is an ok thing to do 🙂 

Perhaps the original author @andscoop has a better opinion than mine?

@dlebech @Fokko When I was originally writing unit tests, I don't believe that we were using docker-compose, or if we were I was not aware of it. I'm not familiar with all the reasons for moving to docker-compose, but idk if I see a compelling reason to move away from mocking the responses in the hook as all responses are known before hand.

The `SqlOperator` has a slightly different use-case than the `GenericTransfer` operator, but they both similarly abstract the `DbApiHook` from the operator via `BaseHook.get_hook(..)`, hence why we don't have a `PostgresGenericTransfer`, `MySqlGenericTransfer`, or etc..  `SqlOperator` isn't intended to fetch any rows from the database, just execute SQL with either success/failure.
@fenglu-g when can we expect to see 1.10.1 version in Google Composer? Where is still 1.9.0

@feng-tao Any feedbacks on this PR? 
@Fokko please suggest if we still want to use `from airflow.api.common.experimental import pool` moving forward. Thanks both!

As https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3460 / https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2355 now is in 1.10 I suggest to not consider this change because it would change behaviour again. Closing this.
anyone can help to review and merge this change? thanks.
@seelmann , I put some small comments / questions on the pr. Great work!
Actually if the viewer has DAG level  permission(https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/master/airflow/www_rbac/views.py#L502), he should be able to view the log.
But we could commit it for now and revisit if we should take it out from viewer permission. cc @jgao54
@XD-DENG , I would prefer to update the `bootstrap-theme.css` and not quite sure what is your concern. Are you concerning updating `bootstrap-theme.css` won't propagate back to npm?

sorry for the delay, haven't fully reviewed yet. And one thing worth mentioning is that the community has been discussed about DagFetcher(https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3138) for some time, and I wonder whether you have considered your change with the DagFetcher compatibility.
@gautamsumeet Please reopen when meeting contribution guidelines.
Given this change has correlation with DagFetcher(https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3138), it would be good to get some input from Max @mistercrunch  .
Great work BTW !
I think the code lack testing, and side qq: do we want to have more hooks / operators under contrib folder BTW? How do we know whether it works or not or how well does it get maintained?

@feng-tao Thank you for bringing up the DagFetcher discussion, I was not aware of that PR before( quite an interesting PR tho, I'll keep an eye on it and provide help if needed). I took a quick look at the PR and I believe it will work perfectly with this change as this change is more like decoupling some existing logic but not changing foundations and the dag fetching is an independent step before the parsing happens.
@Fokko Sounds good. I'll dive in then and take a swing at cleaning it up.

@Fokko My apologies for replying 2 months later (I was working on other high priority projects and now returning to work on Airflow). 
Good question, the primary reason being that the retries in Airflow are mainly meant to handle transient errors where 3-5 retries suffice (or maybe 5 min window). This PR tries to address a larger infrastructure outage that can last several hours.

A user may have a legitimate case for only retrying 3 times (say a particular service is flaky at really high load).  Having shorter retries for transient errors ensures enough robustness for flaky services but not high enough that they completely mask unreliable services.

The solution I'm proposing tries to be more intelligent by applying business logic to the particular hook.
If it's indeed a transient-error, then retry according to the existing Airflow logic, but if it's a complete infrastructure outage, then perhaps retry for 2-4 hours. Luckily, services like Hive, Presto, Spark, etc., can provide enough context to make this determination.

Hi @feng-tao , yes, my concern was that if `npm install` operation would "overwrite" our updates in `bootstrap-theme.css`. But seems it's not the case? (sorry I'm not that familiar with `npm`).

Then I will go ahead to modify the commit (I do agree with you that it's much more efficient/elegant to make change in `bootstrap-theme.css` instead)

Hi @feng-tao , I changed it into:

**_Adhoc Queries_ and _Charts_ are no longer supported in the new FAB-based webserver and UI, due to security concerns.**

This may be more explicit/precise.

Regarding the note indicating removing this section after UI migration, I added it as a TODO comment, because I don't think it's necessary to expose it to readers.
LGTM
will merge once CI pass
Thanks @feng-tao
Hi @feng-tao , have updated the commit as discussed. PTAL. Thanks.
Thanks @feng-tao for approval. This is more a fix for 1.10 which does not include DAG level permission yet. Maybe this can be included in 1.10.1 @ashb ?
Closing for now. Please reopen once you have updated the PR.
@dennisobrien Please reopen when you are ready to proceed!
@XD-DENG it's marked for 1.10.1 so will be included, yup :)

I'm not sure I like this as a default permisson. On the one hand needing admin to view logs is wrong, but conversely there could be passwords or other sensitive info in the logs, so maybe just "viewer" shouldn't have access to the logs?

Not sure basically.

Thanks @ashb .

It was me who changed the fix version to 1.10.1 in JIRA, as you suggested in an mail in the emailist.

I have changed a few other tickets to 1.10.1 as well. All of them are sort of bug fix or enhancement. Please check https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2855?filter=-1&jql=resolution%20%3D%20Fixed%20AND%20fixVersion%20%3D%201.10.1%20AND%20assignee%20in%20(XD-DENG)%20order%20by%20updated%20DESC

Thanks!
